words.phonetic: æftɚ wʌn bækslæʃ ɛs oʊn hɑːɹt
words.defineEn: used to describe someone who shares the same qualities, preferences, or values as the person being referred to, often expressing approval or admiration for their similar mindset or behavior
words.defineVi: được sử dụng để mô tả ai đó có cùng phẩm chất, sở thích hoặc giá trị như người được đề cập đến, thường bày tỏ sự tán thành hoặc ngưỡng mộ đối với suy nghĩ hoặc hành vi tương tự của họ

examples: And at that point, I was like, politically agnostic.
We're agnostic to the political party when you go through these doors.
But neutrinos, those weird, super light, super fast, electrically neutral, hard-to-interact-with particles - they are identity-agnostic.
But let's be agnostic about the kinds of places that students might select, adult learners, those who are going straight from high school, to really chart their own path.
words.defineEn: someone who believes it is impossible to know whether God exists or not
words.defineVi: một người tin rằng không thể biết liệu Chúa có tồn tại hay không

examples: And at that point, I was like, politically agnostic.
We're agnostic to the political party when you go through these doors.
But neutrinos, those weird, super light, super fast, electrically neutral, hard-to-interact-with particles - they are identity-agnostic.
But let's be agnostic about the kinds of places that students might select, adult learners, those who are going straight from high school, to really chart their own path.
words.defineEn: (of a person) believing that the existence of God or supernatural is unknown and unknowable
words.defineVi: (của một người) tin rằng sự tồn tại của Chúa hoặc siêu nhiên là không biết và không thể biết được

examples: Their approach to sports teaching broke the mold.
To my way of thinking, this approach is more efficient.
The car approached a sharp bend in the road and slowed down.
A curious sheep approached me and sniffed my hand.
As midnight approaches, Buddhist temples around the country begin ringing out the old year.
words.defineEn: a way of doing something or dealing with a problem
words.defineVi: một cách để làm một cái gì đó hoặc đối phó với một vấn đề

words.word: to [be] in a minority of one
words.phonetic: təbi ɪn ɐ maɪnɔːɹᵻɾi ʌv wʌn
words.defineEn: to have a particular point of view that is rare and unusual among others
words.defineVi: để có một quan điểm cụ thể là hiếm và bất thường trong số những người khác

examples: He has very firmly held religious beliefs.
She had a sure belief that hard work would lead to success.
The charity organization's mission statement emphasized the belief that poverty is no sin and that everyone deserves dignity and respect.
After careful consideration, he abandoned his previous beliefs and embraced a new ideology.
Plenty of Christians have tried their hand at putting their beliefs into prose or poetry, usually with calamitous aesthetic results.
words.defineEn: something that we think is true or real
words.defineVi: một cái gì đó mà chúng tôi nghĩ là đúng hoặc thực

examples: The superintendent believed Lancaster's story.
I believed his lies for years.
Scientists believe that a major breakthrough is on the horizon.
Many sports pundits believe the vultures are circling for the team's beleaguered head coach.
His opponents believe he is definitely on the run.
words.defineEn: to hold an opinion that something is the case
words.defineVi: để giữ một ý kiến rằng một cái gì đó là trường hợp

examples: He strikes an attitude of bravery and lonely defiance.
The make-or-break factor in this delicate post-course period is the attitude of the person's immediate superior.
He struck an attitude of offended dignity and marched out of the room.
Their arrogant attitude is what really made my hackles rise.
Sticks and stones may break my bones, but my positive attitude will never falter.
words.defineEn: the way a person thinks or feels about something or someone, often affecting their behavior and decisions
words.defineVi: cách một người suy nghĩ hoặc cảm nhận về một cái gì đó hoặc ai đó, thường ảnh hưởng đến hành vi và quyết định của họ

examples: As a leader, it's important to be confident and assertive, because make yourself all honey and the flies will devour you.
Even though he's usually quiet and unassuming, my brother can be incredibly assertive and commanding when he's at home - every dog is a lion at home, as they say.
When dealing with customer service, it can be helpful to be assertive and persistent, as the squeaky wheel gets the grease and is more likely to receive a satisfactory resolution.
And that whole process actually is being more assertive.
But the boycott also reflects a more assertive Beijing.
words.defineEn: confident in expressing one's opinions, ideas or needs in a clear, direct, and respectful manner
words.defineVi: tự tin bày tỏ quan điểm, ý tưởng hoặc nhu cầu của mình một cách rõ ràng, trực tiếp và tôn trọng

words.defineEn: to have the same ideas or opinions as those of someone else's
words.defineVi: để có những ý tưởng hoặc quan điểm tương tự như của người khác

words.defineEn: to believe something to be the case
words.defineVi: để tin rằng một cái gì đó là trường hợp

words.phonetic: sɛt ɪn wʌn bækslæʃ ɛs weɪz
words.defineEn: to refuse to change one's opinions, behaviors, habits, etc.
words.defineVi: từ chối thay đổi ý kiến, hành vi, thói quen của một người, v.v.

examples: The CEO and the marketing director are in each other's pocket, resulting in biased and unbalanced strategies for the company.
People are so biased about everything.
He's pretty biased.
But, of course, we’re super biased about what’s plausible.
Sometimes, this can lead to bad judgments and biased opinions.
words.defineEn: tending to be for or against someone or something in an unfair way
words.defineVi: có xu hướng ủng hộ hoặc chống lại ai đó hoặc điều gì đó một cách không công bằng

words.defineEn: to be vastly different from each other in terms of opinions, attitude, etc.
words.defineVi: khác nhau rất nhiều về quan điểm, thái độ, v.v.

words.defineEn: extremely self-assertive in a way that annoys others
words.defineVi: cực kỳ tự khẳng định theo cách khiến người khác khó chịu

examples: Chameleons actually have taste preferences.
Guy's a chameleon.
Chameleons change color to make a statement.
This synthetic chameleon skin has just one layer of nano-scale arrays.
Chameleons don’t change color to match their environment.
words.defineEn: someone whose opinion changes in accordance with the situation
words.defineVi: ai đó có ý kiến thay đổi phù hợp với tình hình

examples: Your consciousness is like a spotlight on a busy stage.
She never regained consciousness.
This influenced public consciousness.
Is our consciousness then an emergent property of the cells in our brain?
What is consciousness?
words.defineEn: one's ideas, beliefs, and opinions about a specific subject
words.defineVi: ý tưởng, niềm tin và quan điểm của một người về một chủ đề cụ thể

examples: The political debate seemed to go on endlessly, with the candidates going from pillar to post without reaching a consensus.
Practice consensus building.
I built consensus around it.
Nonetheless, scientific consensus is a powerful tool.
What was the consensus about him?
words.defineEn: an agreement reached by all members of a group
words.defineVi: một thỏa thuận đạt được bởi tất cả các thành viên của một nhóm

examples: The chocolate mousse had a velvety consistency thanks to carrageen.
He added plain flour to the sauce, thickening it to a creamy consistency for the pasta dish.
The soup contained a thickening agent that gave it a rich and creamy consistency.
The vegan gummy candies used a plant-based gelling agent to achieve a chewy and gel-like consistency.
She uses cornflour to thicken her homemade fruit jam, achieving the perfect consistency for spreading on toast.
words.defineEn: the quality of always acting or being the same way, or having the same opinions or standards
words.defineVi: chất lượng luôn hành động hoặc giống nhau, hoặc có cùng quan điểm hoặc tiêu chuẩn

examples: The stock portfolio showed a steady yield, generating consistent profits for the shareholders.
She believes that with the right mindset and consistent effort, any dream is achievable.
The writer understands that diligence is the mother of good luck, and that success in writing requires consistent effort, discipline, and hard work.
The gardener tended to their plants with consistent care and attention, trusting that slow and steady wins the race, and eventually grew a beautiful garden
"In learning a new skill, consistent practice and small improvements can lead to mastery, as many a little makes a mickle," said the instructor during the class.
words.defineEn: following the same course of action or behavior over time
words.defineVi: theo cùng một quá trình hành động hoặc hành vi theo thời gian

examples: He has the courage of his convictions.
The conviction of the billionaire sends a message to the world that no one gets a free pass to break the law.
Lead your own life and have the courage of your convictions.
When we learned of the conviction, we dropped him like a hot potato.
George is a decent fella, it's just that he lacks the courage of his convictions.
words.defineEn: a belief or opinion that is very strong
words.defineVi: một niềm tin hoặc ý kiến đó là rất mạnh mẽ

examples: Current drilling technology thus barely scrapes the surface.
The current situation is spelling disaster for the project.
The clock on my computer screen shows the current time and date.
We discuss current scientific advancements and discoveries in science class.
He was happy with his current phone and saw no need to spend money on a new one.
words.defineEn: a set of ideas, feelings, or opinions shared among a group of individuals
words.defineVi: một tập hợp các ý tưởng, cảm xúc, hoặc ý kiến được chia sẻ giữa một nhóm các cá nhân

examples: The film received lavish praise from critics for its groundbreaking visual effects, compelling storyline, and outstanding performances.
Right in the middle of the review is a left-handed compliment: the critic praises the actor for his "startling career departure."
The mayor's critics were laughing up their sleeves when news of the scandal was first reported.
The President answered his critics by fighting fire with fire.
She was a critic who loomed large in literary circles.
words.defineEn: someone who gives their personal standpoint of a movie, play, etc. as a job
words.defineVi: ai đó đưa ra quan điểm cá nhân của họ về một bộ phim, vở kịch, v.v. như một công việc

examples: And in hot weather, humans may hold a decided advantage.
This week, I think, that facebook decided to take OFF.
And so, they decided, you know, to pool their money together and try to find, you know, a ship to go Back Home.
words.defineEn: having clear and definite opinions
words.defineVi: có ý kiến rõ ràng và dứt khoát

examples: To take a deep breath.
As I bite into a black cherry, its deep red juice stains my lips, leaving behind a sweet aftertaste.
The experienced lawyer is streets ahead of her young colleagues, with a deep understanding of the law and years of courtroom experience.
He knew deep down inside that she was right.
His deep love of music moved him to take lessons with Dr. Hill.
words.defineEn: (of a person) tending to refrain from sharing one's ideas with others or to hide their true feelings and intentions in a mysterious way
words.defineVi: (của một người) có xu hướng không chia sẻ ý tưởng của mình với người khác hoặc che giấu cảm xúc và ý định thực sự của họ một cách bí ẩn

words.defineEn: having a strong set of beliefs and opinions that are unlikely to change
words.defineVi: có một tập hợp niềm tin và ý kiến mạnh mẽ không có khả năng thay đổi

words.defineEn: having a specific feeling, opinion, or attitude about someone or something
words.defineVi: có một cảm giác cụ thể, ý kiến, hoặc thái độ về một ai đó hoặc một cái gì đó

words.defineEn: a person who pretends to disagree with an opinion or idea just to promote a discussion concerning a particular subject
words.defineVi: một người giả vờ không đồng ý với ý kiến hoặc ý tưởng chỉ để thúc đẩy một cuộc thảo luận liên quan đến một chủ đề cụ thể

examples: Instead, it shields science from becoming unchallenged dogma.
We call this universal pathway the central dogma of biology, because it sounds really cool, and because it’s something that all life shares.
Early collections like the Quranic manuscripts at Chinguetti were more centered around storing and spreading religious dogma.

One of the things you’ve written and talked about in speeches is kind of a culture here in Silicon Valley and a culture of, you know, there’s a very strong dogma at Facebook of making the world more open and connected and seeing the social good of this tool that they’ve created.

But I think that was smart of Trump, to sort of take that and buck traditional Republican dogma when it came to populism and globalism, and that he was going to bring trade back, and that he was going to fight these trade wars, and he was going to fight illegal immigration in a way that the Romneys and the Paul Ryans of the world were not promising.
words.defineEn: a belief or a belief system held by an authority who proclaims it to be undeniably true and expects immediate acceptance
words.defineVi: một niềm tin hoặc một hệ thống niềm tin được nắm giữ bởi một cơ quan tuyên bố nó là sự thật không thể phủ nhận và mong đợi sự chấp nhận ngay lập tức

words.defineEn: being convinced that everything one believes in is true and others are wrong
words.defineVi: bị thuyết phục rằng mọi thứ một người tin vào là đúng và những người khác là sai

words.defineEn: someone who does not provide a definite answer for a question, particularly when being asked in a poll
words.defineVi: một người không cung cấp một câu trả lời rõ ràng cho một câu hỏi, đặc biệt là khi được hỏi trong một cuộc thăm dò ý kiến

words.defineEn: the state in which one holds two opposing ideas at the same time
words.defineVi: trạng thái trong đó một người nắm giữ hai ý tưởng đối lập cùng một lúc

words.defineEn: having firm, unchanging opinions, beliefs, or ideas
words.defineVi: có quan điểm, niềm tin hoặc ý tưởng vững chắc, không thay đổi

examples: According to Pew, about 17 percent of adult Americans identify as white evangelicals.
But among white evangelical Americans, interest in the vaccine isn't as widespread.
As a staunch evangelical Christian, he had questioned scientific advice.
Many evangelical leaders work to overcome reluctance to receive inoculations among their followers.
We reached out to some evangelicals in our viewership to ask them about their attitudes towards the vaccines.
words.defineEn: very eager to persuade people to accept one's views or opinions
words.defineVi: rất mong muốn thuyết phục mọi người chấp nhận quan điểm hoặc ý kiến của một người

words.defineEn: a set of words or actions meant to make people accept one's strong views or opinions
words.defineVi: một tập hợp các từ hoặc hành động nhằm làm cho mọi người chấp nhận quan điểm hoặc ý kiến mạnh mẽ của một người

examples: Then you do exponents.
You just add the exponents.
A is an exponent right here.
Then you subtract 1 from the exponent.
But this is an exponent.
words.defineEn: a supporter of a theory, belief, idea, etc. who tries to persuade others that it is true or good in order to gain their support
words.defineVi: một người ủng hộ một lý thuyết, niềm tin, ý tưởng, v.v. người cố gắng thuyết phục người khác rằng điều đó là đúng hoặc tốt để nhận được sự ủng hộ của họ

examples: I mean, I was on with one of these pundits from Fox News, and they were telling me that I’m a flip-flopper.
words.defineEn: one who makes an abrupt change of opinion, especially a politician
words.defineVi: một người thay đổi quan điểm đột ngột, đặc biệt là một chính trị gia

words.defineEn: someone who prioritizes their own opinions, ideas, and beliefs over other people's, especially about religion or politics
words.defineVi: một người ưu tiên quan điểm, ý tưởng và niềm tin của họ hơn người khác, đặc biệt là về tôn giáo hoặc chính trị

examples: It’s pretty forceful.
But to the Trump people, it’s too forceful.
This included everything from the forceful frontierism of the Homestead Act, to Teddy Roosevelt’s regulation of New York lodging houses.
He is both entertaining and forceful at a number of moments in this hearing, once taking over for the interlocutor, the investigator who had come in to speak on behalf of the committee.
We are engaged right now in forceful deterrence, but I have to say, we don't rule out anything.
words.defineEn: (of people or opinions) strong and demanding in manner
words.defineVi: (của người hoặc ý kiến) mạnh mẽ và đòi hỏi theo cách
